['However, I have included them based on possible interpretations:**', 'Unfed – Directly implies that someone has been deprived of food.', 'Undernourished – A condition resulting from insufficient nutrient intake over time.', 'Malnourished – Suffering from a lack of proper nutrition, often used to describe chronic hunger situations.', 'Starving – An acute state of extreme hunger or deprivation.', 'Famished – A strong feeling of being very hungry; synonymous with starving.', "Hungry stomach – Refers directly to the sensation of needing food (although it's more metaphorical than literal).", 'Inadequately fed – Suggests that someone hasn’t received enough food, though not necessarily immediately or acutely.', 'Underfed – Lacking adequate amounts of food over a period.', 'Deprived of food – Directly indicates being left without access to food', 'Nutrient-deficient – Lacks essential dietary nutrients, can be a result of prolonged hunger or poor eating habits.', 'Fasting (when unintended) – Refers to voluntarily abstaining from food; when it is not by choice, this term may apply.', "Empty belly – A colloquial expression for feeling hungry with no food inside one's stomach.", 'Goiter (indirectly related) - While a goiter itself refers to the enlargement of the thyroid gland, it can sometimes be associated with iodine deficiency which could occur in conditions of poor nutrition or hunger', 'Vitamin deficiency – Can result from long-term inadequate eating but does not specifically imply immediate hunger.', 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - While being a picky eater is more about selective eating habits, it can sometimes contribute to feeling hungry due to limited intake of sufficient calories or nutrients.', 'Food insecurity – A broader term that encompasses uncertainty and risk of losing access to food; may include periods when one feels left hungry.']

['Here are some factors to consider:', 'Miranda Rights - Whether or not the accused was advised of their Miranda Rights prior to any custodial interrogation, ensuring they were aware of their right to remain silent and have an attorney present.', 'Voluntariness - The evidence must be given voluntarily without coercion or undue influence from law enforcement officers.', "Legality of Search and Seizure – Evidence obtained via search should comply with the Fourth American Constitution'", 'Chain of Custody - Establishing that the evidence has been handled and preserved in an uncontaminated manner since its collection to maintain its integrity for trial.', 'Relevance – The evidence must be relevant to the case at hand, as dictated by Rule 401 of the Federal Rules of Evidence or similar state rules.', 'Admissibility - Ensuring that the probative value of the evidence is not substantially outweighed by unfair prejudice, confusion, misleading the jury, undue delay, wasting time, or needlessly presenting cumulative evidence as per Rule 403.', 'Hearsay Rules – If the evidence consists of statements made outside of court, determining whether it falls under any exceptions to hearsay prohibitions in the Federal Rules of Evidence Rule 801-807 or similar state rules.', 'Authentication - The proponent must demonstrate that the evidence is what they claim it to be, per Rule 901.', 'Best Evidence Rule – If a document is introduced as evidence, ensuring that an original version exists and is presented when applicable under Rule 1002.', 'Right Against Self-Incrimination - The accused has the right to not incriminate themselves, and any forced self-incriminating statement could be deemed inadmissible per the Fifth Amendment.']
